greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array: for s=0 to r-1, a(r,s) = p(s)^(r-s), where p(s) is the s-th primorial number. (p(0)=1, p(1)=2, p(2)=2*3, p(3)=2*3*5,...).
comment: In the expansion of [1+x+x^2+...+x^(r-s)]^s, the x^n coefficient states how many factors of a(r,s) have n prime factors.

As a square array A(n,k) n>=0 k>=1 read by descending antidiagonals, A(n,k) when n>=1 is the least common period over the positive integers of the occurrence of the first n prime numbers as the k-th least operand in the respective integers' prime factorizations (written without exponents). - _Peter Munn_, Jan 25 2017
maple: p:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, ithprime(n)*p(n-1)) end:
seq(seq(a(r, s), s=0..r-1), r=0..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 22 2019
mathematica: Table[a[r, s], {r, 0, 10}, {s, 0, r-1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 07 2019 *)
results.author: _Alford Arnold_, Jan 15 2003
